pullRequest.body:
Writing

```lean
import Bar1
import Bar2

deprecated_module since yyyy-mm-dd
```
in file `A.lean` means that any file that imports `A` will have `import A` flagged with a suggestion to import `Bar1` and `Bar2` instead.

[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60Deprecated.60.20folder)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [656f3794a8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20987/commits/656f3794a849356c0270e78ed64c80c4ccf7e973)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +3.57% | `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter` |

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4862 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 208084 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ addModuleDeprecation`
`+ deprecated.moduleLinter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Maybe `deprecate_module` would be a better name?
!bench
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/31e85a2d-4f2d-4be8-9175-ef451de80283) for commit c2b50b238840463d2ae514bf4e4f818357abc011.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/e76bbc1c-90ea-4b44-a6e4-c4470b68421e/to/31e85a2d-4f2d-4be8-9175-ef451de80283) against commit 8fac96b567d5b979e6a55c99158a99b20e968a96.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+327.990⬝10⁹|(+0.21%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.JacobiZariski`|+1.42⬝10⁹|(+0.12%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12935178395)
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b58d6d59-f2cf-4e26-bc4d-1858458060c0) for commit 51914032118e444eb6ae273949a63942a43d4641.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/e76bbc1c-90ea-4b44-a6e4-c4470b68421e/to/b58d6d59-f2cf-4e26-bc4d-1858458060c0) against commit 8fac96b567d5b979e6a55c99158a99b20e968a96.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+208.707⬝10⁹|(+0.13%)|
|`Mathlib.Data.Array.Lemmas`|+1.495⬝10⁹|(+50.67%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12937352684)
Note to self: I just remembered that there is a "fast" function to parse the imports of a file, right?  I should use that, instead of trying to get to the location of the first module doc.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4d75577f-ffa5-4aed-bdf3-6c20b9728c68) for commit 656f3794a849356c0270e78ed64c80c4ccf7e973.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/790f0ce9-88ca-44a2-bf5e-7ace45e8358d/to/4d75577f-ffa5-4aed-bdf3-6c20b9728c68) against commit 6d3806f20df5903e938b25be0a3dc0a1ffb393fe.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+181.857⬝10⁹|(+0.11%)|
|`Mathlib.Data.Array.Lemmas`|+1.804⬝10⁹|(+59.57%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Abelian.NonPreadditive`|-1.5⬝10⁹|(-3.71%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13074370937)
@adomani there seem to be many unresolved comments on this PR, which came up in the triage meeting (which means it's officially old!). I've marked it `awaiting-author`.

@kbuzzard I don't see that label, so apparently something went wrong. I have applied it now.

(Let me add that I personally would love to see this linter land, and then enforce that PRs removing modules should come with such a deprecation instead. I'm not sure what is needed to get this linter over the line, though.)

> Note to self: I just remembered that there is a "fast" function to parse the imports of a file, right? I should use that, instead of trying to get to the location of the first module doc.

Just in case this is still relevant: the function is [Lean.parseImports'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Lean/Elab/ParseImportsFast.html#Lean.parseImports')

I don't have strong opinions on the environment extension set-up (for lack for time spent with them); the remaining infrastructure looks very good. Find below my usual collection of small polish comments.

I don't have strong opinions on the environment extension set-up (for lack for time spent with them); the remaining infrastructure looks very good. Find below my usual collection of small polish comments.

Thanks, Michael!

I acted on all comments, except extracting the code from the header linter, since that would take a little more thought.

```suggestion
    "deprecate_module " &"since" yyyy:num "-" mm:num "-" dd:num: command => do
```
you're deprecating the current module (singular), not the things it imports!

Thanks!  I am always amazed by how clearly you understand code, even code written by me!

I am also somewhat surprised that code that I write can work, given how many mistakes I make!  :upside_down_face:
Perhaps: "It ignores direct imports in `Init`"? (I was thinking whether you meant "the current module name in Init"... but that doesn't make much sense.)
I wrote "It ignores the `Init` import", since usually `Init` is not explicitly written and it is implicitly imported anyway.
"direct imports"?
Done, thanks!
and "directly imports `A`"
Done, thanks!

bike-shedding, optional
```suggestion
    throwErrorAt mm "The month should be of the form 01, 02, ..., 12!"
Done, thanks!

likewise
```suggestion
    throwErrorAt dd "The day should be of the form 01, 02, ..., 31!"
Done, thanks!
Do you think it's useful to mention that this is enabled in dependencies of mathlib on purpose (so they will get import deprecation warnings)?
Added a sentence!

How about:
```suggestion
  -- `Mathlib.lean` and `Mathlib/Tactic.Lean` are allowed to import deprecated files,
  -- since they (are expected to) import all modules in certain directories.
These two lines are superfluous, right --- from a previous version?
Yes, thanks for catching this!
I'm pretty sure there's room for bikeshedding this formatting. I think we can land something and iterate.
Can we use the same import linking that `find_home` emits?
I don't have time to look into this now, but I like the idea!

These lines are also present in the headerLinter. Can you factor them into a common function?
(I think it's fine if this linter imports the Header linter: didn't we soft-decide that anyway at some point?)
These lines have disappeared now!  :smile:
You could use `if let` here; probably saves two lines and one level of indentation.
Actually: can you do `some (nmStx, _)` instead of the unpacking on line 129?
I like this, thanks!

```suggestion
          m!"'{nmStx}' has been deprecated: please replace this import by \

Perhaps
```suggestion
register_option linter.deprecated.module : Bool := {
```
since options can be nested.
I like this, thanks!

Sorry for the indecision; since we have `@[deprecated]`, I guess `deprecated_module` is more similar.  After all, you're annotating that the module _is_ deprecated - commands don't deprecate things, mathlib contributors do!
No worries and I prefer `deprecated` as well!

```suggestion
elab "#show_deprecated_modules" : command => do
```
since this is a debugging command.
Indeed, I should have placed the `#` in the first place.
This is going to be annoying for downstream libraries which also provide deprecated modules.
Is the fact that the linter can be disabled via `set_option` not a viable solution to this?

With the `IO.Ref` to detect the "first command" of a file, it may be simple to get the linter to never flag import-only files: if the `IO.Ref` is `false` and the currently parsed command is terminal, then the linter can be instructed to do nothing.  Otherwise, the file contains a non-import command, the linter latches onto that one and does its check.

Would this be a better alternative to singling out `Mathlib.lean` and `Mathlib/Tactic.lean`?

```suggestion
          \n{"\n".intercalate <| (undeprecated.map (s"import {·.toString}")).toList}\n"
```
is a little less wonky
I tried a `foldl` approach, avoiding intercalate.

I know that this is a little flimsy, but I argue that it is not too bad in the doc-string!

A robust alternative would be to run the linter only on `Parser.isTerminalCommand` (essentially only at `eoi`).

The `eoi` approach is guaranteed to run once per file (assuming you do not mess with `... in #exit` in your file), but has the disadvantage that you only get the warning at the very top of the file when parsing has reached the very bottom of the file.

pullRequest.title: feat: a linter to deprecate imported modules
